concept.title: HTTP Protocols
concept.shortdesc: You can configure to use HTTP or HTTPS. By default uses HTTP.

conbody.p: HTTP protocolconfiguring for the Data Collector Data Collectorconfiguring the HTTP protocolHTTPS requires an SSL certificate. provides a self-signed certificate so you can use HTTPS immediately. You can also generate a certificate that is self-signed or signed by a certifying authority. Web browsers generally issue a warning for self-signed certificates.
When you configure to use HTTPS, you can have redirect HTTP requests to HTTPS or to ignore them.

When you generate a SSL certificate, use the following files:
keystore file A file that contains the private key and self-signed certificates for the web server. You can create your own keystore file or use the provided keystore file. Store the keystore file in the following location:<SDCinstalldir>/etc The default keystore file is keystore.jks.
keystore password file A file that contains the password to open the Java keystore file. You can create your own keystore password file or use the provided file. Store the keystore password file in the following location:<SDCinstalldir>/etc The default keystore file is keystore-password.txt.
